lines.text:
[voice-over]
I was the last one left after the nuclear holocaust, eh. The whole world had been destroyed, like U.S. blew up Russia and Russia blew up U.S. and Canada. Fortunately, I had been offworld at the time. There wasn't much to do. All the bowling alleys and dounut shops had been wrecked. So's I spent most of my time looking for beer.
I am your father, Luke. Give in to the dark side of the force, you knob.
He saw Jedi 17 times, eh.
The power of the force has stopped you, you hosers.

[to Pam]
If I didn't have puke breath, I'd kiss you.

[to Pam in a beer tank that's being flooded with beer]
My brother and I used to say that drownin' in beer was like heaven, eh? Now he's not here, and I've got two soakers... this isn't heaven. This sucks!

Yeah. OK, well, uh, we found, uh, this mouse in a bottle of YOUR BEER, eh. Like, we was at a party and, uh, a friend of ours - a COP - had some, and HE PUKED. And he said, uh, come here and get free beer or, uh, he'll press charges.

[after Bob has put out the fire at the brewery by urinating on it]
It took you two minutes what would have taken us two hours. If you ever want a job, you come see me.
[Doug and Bob are hooked up to a polygraph lie detector]
What have you done with the disk?
What are you looking at me for? I don't got it.
[Ted looks at the polygraph which doesn't show anything off]
Maybe it's out of gas, eh?
[Doug then passes gas in a loud flatulence noise]
Uh, man! You farted!
It wasn't me, it was the chair!
He's lying!
[now the polograph begins showing activity]
He's definitely lying all right.
And I'd like to point out that these tapes have not been faked, or altered in any way. In fact they have time coding, which is very hard to fake.
For the benefit of the court would you please explain "time coding."
Well, uh... just because I don't know what it is, it doesn't mean I'm lying.
We hope you enjoyed the beer, oh, like I mean the movie, eh.

[to their dog]
Eh... Hosehead, once you get there you can have all the free beer and sausages you want.
This movie was shot in 3B - three beers - and it looks good, eh?
I gotta take a leak so bad I can taste it!
[realizing that the brakes don't work on their speeding van]

[folding his arms]
No point in steering now.
You steer this thing!
I was like a one-man army, like Charlton Heston in "Omega Man." You ever see it? Beauty.
[Bob and Doug are on the witness stand in the courtroom after being sworn on the Bible to tell the truth prior to testimony]
I do.
I do.
I guess we're married, clerk.
Oh.
Where's the honeymoon?
Order, Order!
Gimmie a toasted back bacon, hold the toast.
Don't make me laugh, eh.
I remind you not to speak, until you are spoken to!
He's startin' to sound like the old man. Soon he'll be sending me out for beers.
[Doug sneezes out the two bullets in his nose... which ricochet around the courtroom!]
Hey, you! Six-fifty! Give me $6.50!
[Rosey pulls the parking attendant's jacket down around his arms, hockey style, and shows the guy his fists]
All I got is two fives!

[after taking multiple checks from the opposing hockey team]
Ow, my left nut!

[shadowing Bob and Doug, and waiting outside their house for what seems like hours]
What the *stink* are they *doing* in there?

[to the rough-looking convicts in their jail cell]
Chimp here does the killin'. I don't like to kill. I'm the brains, eh? Like, we got over five billion dollars in our hideout, only some of the money's marked, eh, so we're not spendin' it. We's just waitin'.
Youse guys like a smoke?
No, eh? We want our lungs to be pink when they fry us. Hey, we told 'em we didn't want a lawyer. Chimp here probably just kill him anyway.
[scoffs]
Lawyers are for sucks.
Hey, McKenzie brothers. Your lawyer is here.
[Doug and Bob run out of the cell as the convicts relize too late that they were fooled]

[after pouring a beer for their dad into a glass from a dog dish]
You take it to him.
No way, you take it to him.
No, you.

[both holding the glass]
No! I'm gonna let go. I'm lettin' go and you're takin it.
No! I'm lettin' go.
Let go then.

[both let go and the glass smashes]
Dad! Bob broke your beer!
No I didn't! Doug broke it!
Figures you wouldn't know how to work it if it's got a computer.
Oh yeah, Mister Wizard, you know, eh...
Let me try, I'm a genius.
He once got our dead battery goin' by mixin' bird feces and spit, cause there's like acids in it, eh?
I wouldn't go in there. There's a big skunk in there.

[Flashes his badge]
We know about that. It's a Toronto skunk. My jurisdiction.
You know how to handle one of those big rigs?
Jeez, it's a ten-speed.
Yeah, sure, o' corse, like, uh, we drive 'em, all the time, eh.
Well take off, eh.

[to Claude]
I could crush your head... like a nut... but I won't. Because I need you.
Fleshy-headed mutant. Are you friendly?
No way, eh? Ra-... radiation has made... me an enemy of civilization.

[into a comm unit]
Alpha Base. This is Bob McKenzie. I have a fleshy-headed mutant in sector 16B.
[Bob shoots Doug with a toy foam launcher]
Ahhh! Take off, you hoser.
[During the preview of the Bob and Doug Mackenzie film, a viewer realizes that the film is about nothing]
They did this on the album too!
[Speaking to the inspector]
He broke the gate! Then he took my jacket!... And he hit me!

[referring to Bob]
I can't believe it! He drank it all!
Don't make me steamroll you. Steamroller!
See, if you'd stick to your 12-point maintinence program, eh, then we wouldn't have to jump-start you like this. Oh, no, you had to do it your way... you think you know everything, eh.
Jeez, two minutes for elbowing!

[inflicts a savage beating on reporters]
That's how you handle the press. Come on.
Remind me to pay his bill on time, eh?
Yeah, Chuck Norris for the defense, eh?
Hey we found a dead mouse in our beer eh. That means you owe us a free case.
Ok, all cops, get out of your cars.
[the cops get out of their cars]

Ok, I want to take a head count. Like maybe we'll have some breakfast. Some back bacon sandwiches while we was waiting. Ok, another thing, you all went through the stop sign back there, and that's a moving violation, and my brother and I... we have a lot of parking tickets...
We'll always have our memories. The Colonel's dead. Here we are still enjoying his chicken.
